attributes.action: Introduce more education on black history to British schools
attributes.additional_details: The Uk is one of the most diverse countries in the world and yet racism is still a prevalent issue. To begin to understand race more, we must be more educated on the matter.
attributes.background: Children in this country aren’t taught enough on Black history across the world and in our own country. The curriculum at the moment has very little about black history and so people are uneducated when it comes to circumstances that we see in society today. Add black history to the curriculum.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
